title: So much for “electability”
author: VD
content_html:
Huckabee attracts support from 23% of Likely Republican Primary voters nationwide and Rudy Giuliani earns the vote from 19%. The frontrunners are followed by Mitt Romney at 15%, John McCain at 12%, and Fred Thompson at 9% (see recent daily numbers). Ron Paul currently attracts 5% of Likely Republican Primary voters nationwide.

Now that Huckabee and Paul combined have the same support in the polls as “frontrunners” Giuliani and Thompson, it’s interesting to see that the usual suspects have suddenly dropped the “electability” angle.
